Name: A Day of Growth: Planting in the Gardens on Quail Community Garden
Post Body:
Today was a truly fantastic day at Gardens on Quail as our residents came together to breathe life into our community garden! On this beautiful May 23rd, the sun shone down as our green-thumbed residents dug into the earth, planting a variety of vibrant flowers, herbs, and vegetables that will soon flourish in our shared space.

Cultivating Joy and Connection

There’s something incredibly special about gardening—it’s not just about planting seeds, but about fostering connection and well-being. As our residents worked side by side, smiles were abundant, and the joy of creating something together filled the air. The fresh breeze and the satisfaction of nurturing new life made the experience even more rewarding.

A Garden of Growth and Memories

Our community garden is more than just a place for plants; it’s a living symbol of growth, care, and the bonds that make Gardens on Quail such a warm and welcoming home. Each plant put in the ground today represents our residents' shared commitment to a healthy, active lifestyle and a thriving community.

Looking Forward to More Garden Moments

We couldn’t be more excited to watch our garden grow, and we’re eager to share more updates as the season progresses. Check out our activity calendar for more upcoming events.

‍
Post Summary: Residents at Gardens on Quail enjoyed a wonderful day planting in our community garden on May 23rd. Follow our journey as we cultivate joy and connection.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: A Harvest of Memories: Our Day at the Arvada Harvest Festival
Post Body:
I couldn't be more excited to recap our experience at the 98th Annual Arvada Harvest Festival, where we had the honor of being one of the event sponsors.

A Legacy of Community and Tradition

For those unfamiliar with it, the Arvada Harvest Festival has been a staple in Jefferson County since 1925, celebrating the rich agricultural history of Arvada. Hosted by the Arvada Junior Chamber Foundation, the festival's purpose is to bring generations together, creating memories that will last a lifetime.

The Move to Clear Creek Valley Park

The festival has a new location this year—Clear Creek Valley Park, a refreshing backdrop that showcased the event's community spirit perfectly. The park served as an open canvas for endless activities, vendors, and good vibes all around.

Harvesting New Relationships

While the festival provided plenty of fun and entertainment, it was also a fruitful experience for us in terms of networking and community engagement. We made meaningful connections that will help us continue to enrich the lives of our residents at Gardens on Quail.

Looking Forward

As we look back on this remarkable day, we're not just counting the fun moments or the new friendships formed; we're also looking ahead. We're excited about the relationships that have sprouted and can't wait to nurture them in the days to come. Until next year, Arvada Harvest Festival, we look forward to growing together!

Best,Kyla

‍
Post Summary: Kyla recounts a day of joy, community, and memory-making at this year's Arvada Harvest Festival.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: A Night of Stars
Post Body:
Hollywood glamour arrived at Gardens on Quail this Oscars night as we rolled out the red carpet for our very own Oscar Watch Party. The evening was filled with glitz, glamor, and the communal joy of cinema, making it a truly unforgettable event for everyone involved.

Lights, Camera, Action!

As the stars dazzled on the big screen, our residents shone just as brightly, dressed in their Oscar best. The excitement was palpable as everyone made their grand entrance on the real red carpet, complete with paparazzi—staff members snapping photos to capture the glamor of the night.

Celebrating Cinema

The main lobby was transformed into our mini-theater, decked out with Oscars decor. Our residents enjoyed a selection of fine finger foods and sparkling beverages, adding a taste of luxury to the viewing experience.

Looking Forward to Next Year

Thank you to all our residents and staff for making our Oscar Watch Party a huge success. Here’s to more magical moments and shared celebrations. Be sure to check out our calendar for our next big event!

‍
Post Summary: A recap of our dazzling Oscar Watch Party! Discover how we celebrated cinema’s biggest night with style, smiles, and a real red carpet experience.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Assessing Your Needs: Key Considerations When Evaluating Elder Care Options
Post Body:
I understand that evaluating elder care options is a deeply personal and important decision. It involves considering a multitude of factors that directly impact your or your loved one's well-being, comfort, and overall quality of life. In this article, I want to share some insights and personal guidance on assessing your needs when evaluating you or your loved ones next home.

First and foremost, it's crucial to take a comprehensive look at your care needs. Assess your physical care requirements, such as assistance with daily activities, mobility, and medication management.

If memory challenges are present, consider the specialized support offered by memory care programs. Additionally, pay attention to your social and emotional well-being, as companionship and engaging activities play a vital role in enhancing your overall happiness and contentment.

Please use our Care Need Quiz to help you get started on this process. We also do an in-person intake when and if you get to that stage with us.

As you evaluate elder care options, several key considerations should come to the forefront. Location is an important factor, as proximity to loved ones, medical facilities, and support networks can greatly influence your sense of belonging and peace of mind. If you are new to the area I suggest you view our Senior Resource Guide for the Arvada area.

Amenities and services play a significant role in your day-to-day experience. Look for care options that offer a wide range of amenities, such as delicious dining options, housekeeping services, transportation assistance, and robust wellness programs to support your physical and emotional well-being. Affordability is another critical aspect to consider, so take the time to evaluate costs, explore available financial resources like long-term care insurance or government programs, and ensure the financial feasibility of your chosen care option.

One of the most important factors in selecting an elder care facility is the expertise and dedication of the staff. I encourage you to inquire about the qualifications and training of the care team, ensuring that they possess the skills and compassion necessary to provide exceptional care. Staff-to-resident ratios are also crucial, as they directly impact the amount of attention and support you or your loved one will receive. When you start your process of visiting facilities please use our Match-Up comparison printout along with our handy Facility Visit Checklist to make sure you are asking the right questions and compare facilities against each other to get the one that most fits your needs.

In your search for the right elder care option, don't underestimate the power of reviews and recommendations. Seek out testimonials from current residents and their families to gain insights into the quality of care, the sense of community, and overall satisfaction levels. Hearing firsthand experiences can provide valuable reassurance and help you make a more informed decision.

Remember, this journey is deeply personal, and it's important to trust your instincts. As you tour different facilities, engage with care providers, and interact with current residents, pay attention to how you feel. Your intuition will guide you towards the right fit—the place that truly feels like home.

At our facility, we understand the weight of this decision and the emotions that accompany it. We are here to support you every step of the way, providing a caring and nurturing environment where you or your loved one can thrive. Our dedicated team is committed to ensuring that your needs are met, your comfort is prioritized, and your journey is filled with compassion, dignity, and a sense of belonging.

Please don't hesitate to reach out to us for any questions or to schedule a personal tour. We are honored to be part of your elder care journey, and we look forward to helping you find the perfect care option that brings peace, happiness, and fulfillment to your life.

‍

‍
Post Summary: I want to share some insights and personal guidance on assessing your needs when evaluating you or your loved ones next home.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Blooms from Our Garden Beds: A Morning of Floral Artistry at Gardens on Quail
Post Body:
Hello everyone, this is Leigh, the Executive Director at Gardens on Quail, and I’m delighted to recount the wonderful experience we had creating floral arrangements from our very own garden beds.

The Power of Gardening

We often underestimate the therapeutic value of engaging with nature. This activity was not only creatively stimulating but also provided a meditative space for our residents. Medical research even supports the idea that gardening can improve mental well-being, alleviate stress, and offer physical benefits through gentle exercise.

Our Blooming Garden Beds

We have been tending to our garden beds with love and attention, and the time came to see the fruits—or rather, the flowers—of our labor. This morning, we harvested a vibrant array of blossoms right from our gardens to use in our floral arrangements.

Crafting Floral Arrangements

Under the warm morning sun, we gathered around tables laden with vases, ribbons, and freshly cut flowers. Our residents took their time selecting the blooms that caught their eye, arranging them with both skill and emotion. Each arrangement turned into a personalized piece of art.

Shared Moments

This was a bonding experience for everyone involved. Conversations flowed as easily as the arrangements came together, and we all took a moment to appreciate the beauty around us—both in the flowers and in the community we’ve built here.

A Sustainable Activity

It’s fulfilling to know that the flowers used for our arrangements came from sustainable sources right in our own backyard, affirming our commitment to environmentally responsible practices.

We hope to make floral arrangement sessions a recurring event, so watch this space for more.

Thank you all for making this morning so special.

Best,
Mariah

‍
Post Summary: Learn how Gardens on Quail's residents turned their garden blooms into beautiful, therapeutic floral arrangements.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Bouncing Fun with Balloon Volleyball
Post Body:
Just dropping in to chat about the latest fun that’s been taking over our memory care unit - Balloon Volleyball!

We're always on the lookout for activities that get our residents moving, laughing, and interacting. And let me tell you, Balloon Volleyball checks all those boxes and more. Picture this: a room full of our residents batting a big, bright balloon around, with everyone pitching in to keep it from touching the ground. It’s a hoot!

Don't let the simplicity fool you though. It's not just about batting a balloon around. This game gets our folks moving and grooving, all in the name of fun. It’s gentle on the joints, and helps with things like hand-eye coordination, flexibility, and motor skills. Plus, let's not forget the social aspect - nothing like a friendly game to stir up conversation and laughter!

The magic of Balloon Volleyball lies in its simplicity. Remember the joy of playing with balloons as a kid? It’s like that, but even better because our friends are experiencing it together. A colorful balloon bobbing around the room just naturally invites smiles and cheer.

I’ll tell you what, these sessions are a riot! Full of laughter, light-hearted banter, and good vibes. It’s not about winning or scoring; it’s about having a great time and staying active.

In short, Balloon Volleyball has become a real crowd-pleaser in our memory care unit. We’re excited to keep bringing in more fun activities like this that keep our residents happy and engaged. Here at Gardens on Quail, we’re all about creating a lively, joyful environment where everyone feels at home.

Till next time, stay active and keep those balloons afloat!

‍
Post Summary: We're always on the lookout for activities that get our residents moving, laughing, and interacting.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Building Bridges Between Generations: Our Special Day with Jefferson High School's B.I.O.N.I.C. Team
Post Body:
Recently, we had 12 of our residents visit Jefferson High School for a unique and engaging intergenerational event. The students, part of the school's remarkable B.I.O.N.I.C. team, teamed up with our residents to create beautiful mason jar flower vases, sharing laughter and stories as they worked together.

For those unfamiliar with B.I.O.N.I.C. (which stands for Believe It Or Not I Care), it's an inspiring student-led initiative started in 2004 aimed at creating caring and supportive school environments. B.I.O.N.I.C. teams work tirelessly to prevent bullying and suicides by reaching out to students going through challenging times. Their philosophy is simple yet powerful: let struggling peers know they are seen, they matter, and they are not alone. They are real-life heroes, making a difference in their community every day.

During our event, our residents were deeply touched by the compassion and understanding shown by these young individuals. It was a joy to watch connections being made, stories shared, and lives touched. The creation of the mason jar flower vases was not just a craft activity but a testament to the beautiful bond that was being formed between the young and the old.

I'm thrilled to announce that the event was so inspiring that 9News decided to feature it!

The success of this event has reiterated my belief in the power of intergenerational connections. They have the potential to enrich lives, foster mutual respect, and create an environment of understanding and empathy. The students not only offered our residents a refreshing perspective, but they also gained valuable wisdom from our residents' life experiences.

The B.I.O.N.I.C. team's work has set an excellent example for other communities and we, at Gardens on Quail, are incredibly grateful to have been a part of it. It's been a heartwarming experience to witness our residents and these young students connect and grow together. We look forward to more such enriching interactions in the future.

With warm regards,

Leigh

‍
Post Summary: Recently, we had 12 of our residents visit Jefferson High School for a unique and engaging intergenerational event.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Catching Air: A Day of Parachute Fun
Post Body:
Inside the common area of our memory care neighborhood our residents came together for an exhilarating day of parachute games. The event was a vibrant blend of color, movement, and laughter, proving that fun isn’t just an outdoor activity!

A Colorful Canopy of Joy

With a large, colorful parachute in hand, our residents gathered around in a circle, gripping the handles tightly. The room echoed with laughter as we shook the parachute up and down, causing our Broncos themed lightweight balls to bounce whimsically on the colorful canvas. The backdrop of our familiar common area added a cozy touch to the lively scene.

Fun Meets Fitness

This activity was more than just fun; it was a sneaky form of exercise. The residents engaged their arms and shoulders, lifting and lowering the parachute, which is great for maintaining upper body strength. The best part? Everyone was having so much fun, they barely noticed they were exercising.

Laughter and Connections

It’s moments like these that strengthen our community. Watching the parachute's colors ripple across the room brought out smiles and encouraged everyone to interact and enjoy the moment together. It was a beautiful sight—vibrant colors and happy faces all around.

Stay Tuned for More

A big thank you to all the staff and residents who made this indoor parachute day a blast. We’re always looking forward to more creative and engaging activities here at Arvada's top Memory Care unit at the Gardens on Quail.

‍
Post Summary: Discover how we combine fun, exercise, and community spirit in our memory care program.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Discussing Elder Care: Nurturing Open and Supportive Conversations with Your Loved One
Post Body:
Having meaningful discussions about elder care with your loved one can be emotionally challenging, yet it's an essential step in ensuring their well-being and future.

At our facility, we understand the importance of open communication and the need for guidance in starting these conversations. In this post, we will explore helpful strategies and insights on how to initiate and navigate discussions about elder care with sensitivity, empathy, and respect.

  1. Choose the Right Time and Place:

Select a calm and comfortable environment where both you and your loved one can feel at ease. Find a time when you are both relaxed and not rushed, allowing for an uninterrupted and focused conversation.

  1. Approach with Empathy:

Acknowledge that discussing elder care may evoke a range of emotions. Show empathy and understanding towards your loved one's feelings, concerns, and fears. Create a safe space for open expression, ensuring they feel heard and validated.

  1. Use Active Listening:

Engage in active listening by giving your full attention to your loved one. Encourage them to share their thoughts, desires, and worries about their future care. Avoid interrupting or jumping to conclusions. Validate their feelings and provide reassurance that their voice matters.

  1. Express Your Concerns:

Share your observations and concerns regarding their well-being and safety. Discuss any changes in health, memory, or daily functioning that you have noticed. Emphasize that your intention is to support and ensure their happiness and comfort.

  1. Focus on Shared Goals:

Frame the conversation around shared goals and values. Highlight the benefits of elder care, such as enhanced socialization, access to specialized services, and a secure and supportive environment. Reinforce that the ultimate objective is to ensure their overall well-being and happiness.

  1. Collaborate and Involve Them:

Involve your loved one in the decision-making process. Ask for their input, preferences, and desires regarding their care. Engage them in exploring different care options and encourage their active participation in visiting and evaluating potential facilities.

  1. Provide Information and Resources:

Equip yourself with information about different types of care, services, and resources available. Share this knowledge with your loved one to help them understand the possibilities and make informed decisions. Offer brochures, articles, or online resources that they can explore at their own pace.

  1. Be Patient and Respectful:

Remember that acceptance and decision-making may take time. Be patient and respectful of your loved one's pace and readiness to embrace the idea of elder care. Avoid pushing or imposing your own agenda, and be prepared for multiple conversations as their understanding and comfort levels evolve.

  1. Involve Other Family Members:

Incorporate the perspectives and support of other family members if possible. Encourage open dialogue among family members to ensure everyone is on the same page and working together to make the best decisions for your loved one's care.

  1. Seek Professional Guidance:

If needed, consult with elder care professionals, such as social workers or care advisors (we have some listed on our Arvada Senior Guide, who can provide expert advice, facilitate discussions, and address any concerns or questions. Their experience and guidance can be invaluable in navigating the complexities of elder care.

Remember, discussing elder care requires patience, empathy, and open-mindedness. By approaching the conversation with love, respect, and understanding, you can foster an environment where your loved one feels supported, empowered, and involved in decisions about their care. Together, you can find a solution that prioritizes their well-being, happiness, and sense of belonging.

At our facility, we are committed to supporting you and your loved one throughout this journey. Our compassionate team is available to provide guidance, answer questions, and help facilitate these important conversations. Together, we can ensure that your loved one receives the care they deserve in a nurturing

‍
Post Summary: Having meaningful discussions about elder care with your loved one can be emotionally challenging, yet it's an essential step in ensuring their well-being and future.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Easter Eggstravaganza
Post Body:
Spring is a time of renewal and celebration, and what better way to embrace the season than with a colorful Easter egg dyeing event at Gardens on Quail? Our residents gathered in the common area, transforming it into a vibrant workshop brimming with creativity and cheer.

A Palette of Possibilities

Armed with dyes in every hue, brushes, and a bounty of hard-boiled eggs, our residents set to work turning each egg into a masterpiece. The tables were strewn with newspapers, cups filled with colorful dyes, and plates of eggs ready for transformation. It was a festive setup that invited everyone to express their artistic flair.

As the eggs dried on racks, residents shared their past Easter memories and traditions, connecting over stories from childhood egg hunts to family gatherings. This storytelling turned our crafting session into more than just an activity; it was a meaningful exchange of memories and a forging of new ones.

Looking Forward to More Festivities

Thank you to all the residents and staff who participated in making this Easter egg dyeing event a success. It’s these moments of joy and community that make Gardens on Quail a special place to live.

Stay tuned to our event calendar for more seasonal celebrations and activities that bring color and cheer to our Assisted Living and Memory Care community!

‍
Post Summary: A delightful recap of our Easter egg dyeing event! Discover the creativity and community spirit that brightened our celebration of spring.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Farm Fresh Delights
Post Body:
This August, the residents of Gardens on Quail enjoyed a slice of farm life right in our own backyard. We had the pleasure of shucking fresh corn delivered straight from the Oschner family farm. The event was not just a prelude to a delicious meal prepared by Chef Melissa and her team but also a wonderful opportunity for community engagement and sharing stories of agricultural heritage.

A Hands-On Experience

Residents gathered around in our central lobby, rolling up their sleeves and diving into the task of shucking. The rhythmic sounds of husks being peeled back mixed with residents’ laughter and chatter, creating a lively atmosphere that energized everyone involved.

From Farm to Table

Chef Melissa explained the journey of the corn from farm to table, emphasizing the importance of supporting local farms and enjoying seasonal produce. As residents worked, she shared tips on cooking corn and discussed various recipes that would later transform our freshly shucked corn into a gourmet treat for dinner.

The Joy of Sharing

Shucking corn together not only brought back memories for many of our residents who recalled their own experiences with gardening and farming but also fostered a sense of accomplishment. There’s something truly satisfying about preparing food that you've had a hand in harvesting.

Culinary Celebrations

The fruits of our labor were soon enjoyed by all, as Chef Melissa and her team served up the freshly cooked corn at dinner. The sweet, buttery flavor of the corn was a testament to the freshness of the produce and the skill of our kitchen team. The meal was a hit, with residents complimenting the chef and her team for the delicious preparation that highlighted the natural sweetness of the corn.

Grateful for Nature's Bounty

Events like these are a delightful reminder of the simple pleasures of eating well and sharing a meal. We are thankful to the Oschner family farm for providing us with such high-quality produce and to our residents and staff for participating in this joyful summer activity.

Stay tuned to our blog for more stories and updates from the Gardens on Quail as we continue to celebrate the seasons with great food and even better company!

‍
Post Summary: Relive the joy of our Corn Shucking Day at the Gardens on Quail, where residents enjoyed fresh produce from the Oschner family farm and a delightful farm-to-table meal prepared by Chef Melissa and her team.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Gardens on Quail's Craft Show Extravaganza: More Than Just Crafts
Post Body:
Hello, Leigh here from Gardens on Quail, and I’m thrilled to share how our recent Craft Show Extravaganza unfolded. We held the event this past Saturday, and it was a resounding success!

Supporting the Alzheimer's Association

Firstly, I want to express my deepest thanks to everyone who participated and visited the Craft Show. We dedicated this event not only to creativity but also to philanthropy. All the proceeds from table rentals went straight to the Alzheimer's Association to fund their invaluable research and support services.

The Creative Feast

Local artisans brought their incredible handcrafted items to display and sell. From unique home decor to personalized gifts, the range of talent was truly amazing. It was a fantastic opportunity to support local artisans while finding one-of-a-kind pieces.

The Raffle

The day was not complete without our raffle. Thank you to everyone who participated and congratulations to our winners! We had some truly fantastic door prizes that added an extra layer of excitement to the event.

Community Spirit

This event reaffirmed the strength of our local community. Your support not only made the Craft Show successful but also significantly contributed to a crucial cause and help our residents in our Memory Care community. We couldn't have done it without you.

Looking Forward

Based on the success of this Craft Show Extravaganza, we are already excitedly planning future community events. Stay tuned for more details!

Best,|
Mariah
Post Summary: Read about the dual success of Gardens on Quail’s Craft Show in supporting local artisans and raising funds for the Alzheimer's Association.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Goat Yoga: A Delightful Day Filled with Smiles at Gardens on Quail
Post Body:
Today, I bring you the highlights of a unique event that has brought an extraordinary amount of joy and laughter to our residents: a visit from Rocky Mountain Goat Yoga!

While our residents might not have perfected the Downward Dog or the Warrior pose, they certainly enjoyed handing out goat treats, which quickly turned into a mix of giggles, baa-maste moments, and adorable photo ops.

These little creatures, roaming freely around our residents in our interior courtyard, brought an air of fun and playfulness that had everyone grinning from ear to ear.

Rocky Mountain Goat Yoga is a unique organization, which blends the therapeutic attributes of yoga and animal companionship. The baby goats are rescued animals, many of whom have faced neglect or abandonment early in their lives. So, in addition to filling our day with joy, our goat visit played a part in offering these lovable animals a healthier and happier lifestyle.

Jim Naron, who launched Rocky Mountain Goat Yoga in 2017, has been creating these unique yoga experiences in Colorado, inspired by Laney Morse from Oregon. By maintaining a sustainable herd through collaborations with local goat rescues, Rocky Mountain Goat Yoga continues to spread joy while prioritizing animal welfare.

Witnessing our residents' faces light up with joy as they interacted with these friendly goats was an incredible experience. Even though some of our yoga enthusiasts may not have achieved the perfect yoga pose, they got something far more valuable – a day filled with joy, laughter, and connections.

Thank you, Rocky Mountain Goat Yoga, for bringing this delightful event to our community. Our residents and staff alike are still chuckling over the sheer fun of the day. We look forward to more such heartwarming and entertaining events in the future!

With warmest regards,

‍
Post Summary: I bring you the highlights of a unique event that has brought an extraordinary amount of joy and laughter to our residents
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Growing Together: The Magic of Gardens on Quail's Garden Club and Community Gardens in Arvada
Post Body:
Hello there!

I'm Leigh, the Executive Director at Gardens on Quail, an award-winning Assisted Living and Independent Plus facility right here in Arvada. Today, I'm excited to share with you the beauty and joy we find in our Garden Club, and the green tapestry of community gardens scattered throughout our lovely city.

Every spring, our Garden Club comes alive with residents who are ready to get their hands dirty and hearts full. There's something enchanting about planting a seed, nurturing it with care, and watching it grow into a beautiful flower or a delicious vegetable. At Gardens on Quail, our raised garden beds offer everyone - from gardening veterans to enthusiastic beginners - a chance to experience this magic.

But our Garden Club is more than just about gardening. It's a vibrant social club that brings us all together, strengthening the fabric of our community. We share stories, laughter, and advice over the garden beds, fostering bonds that continue to bloom much like our plants.

Here in Arvada, we're incredibly fortunate to have a strong network of community gardens that embody the same spirit. These shared spaces offer a beautiful platform for individuals to come together, connect with nature, and contribute to the local ecosystem.

Arvada's community gardens, such as the one at North Arvada Middle School Community Garden, Common Earth Garden or Rose Roots Community Garden, are wonderful places that cultivate not just plants but also a strong sense of belonging and stewardship. Many residents find joy and a sense of purpose in nurturing a plot, and the harvest becomes a sweet reward for their efforts. If you are just getting started gardening there are monthly classes available as well

Whether it's our Garden Club or the community gardens around Arvada, these green spaces hold a mirror to our collective spirit - one of resilience, growth, and unity. They remind us that, much like a seed transforming into a plant, we too have the potential to grow and bloom wherever we are planted.

I invite you to experience this firsthand. Join us at our Garden Club or explore a community garden in Arvada. It's a wonderful journey of growth, both for yourself and for the community around you.

Until next time, keep growing!

‍
Post Summary: Every spring, our Garden Club comes alive with residents who are ready to get their hands dirty and hearts full.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Hallway Bowling: A Memory Care Strike!
Post Body:
Hello, Gardens on Quail family,

Leigh here, your Executive Director at Gardens on Quail, with another heartwarming update from our beloved Memory Care unit.

You might be surprised to hear this, but our corridors recently transformed into a bustling bowling alley! That's right, we had an exhilarating afternoon of indoor bowling, with plenty of strikes, cheers, and laughter filling our hallways. The sight of our residents beaming with joy and engaging in friendly competition was truly a delight to witness.

Bowling, as simple as it may seem, is a fantastic activity for our memory care residents. It provides both a physical and mental workout that promotes coordination, balance, and cognitive skills. Not only is it a fun and social activity, but it also plays a crucial role in encouraging physical exercise, promoting cardiovascular health, and stimulating neural connections.

It's always inspiring to see our residents thrive and enjoy these interactive activities that have been tailored to benefit their physical and cognitive wellbeing. Seeing their excitement when they hit a strike or make a spare, cheering each other on, and eagerly taking their turn, not only builds camaraderie but also fosters a sense of accomplishment.

At Gardens on Quail, we are continually working to provide our residents with a variety of fun and beneficial activities. Our dedicated team always ensures these activities are designed to promote our residents' health and happiness while creating an engaging and joyful environment.

This indoor bowling event has certainly set the bar high, but we are excited about the future activities planned for our wonderful residents. I am personally looking forward to sharing more uplifting stories from our Memory Care unit.

Stay tuned for more updates, and remember, the game of life continues here at Gardens on Quail, and we're all striving for that perfect strike!

With warm regards,

Leigh Boney
Executive Director, Gardens on Quail

‍
Post Summary: Embrace the spirit of resilience and enjoyment exhibited by our memory care residents during our fun-filled indoor bowling event.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Hawaiian Luau for a Cause!
Post Body:
I’m thrilled to announce an exciting event that will bring a slice of paradise to our community - our Hawaiian Luau, scheduled for June 9th in our courtyard. This isn't just about enjoying the tropical vibe; it's about celebrating community and supporting a meaningful cause.

Your $35 ticket transports you to a Hawaiian getaway, beginning with a tantalizing lunch at 12:00 pm that promises to delight your taste buds with tropical flavors. Then, at 1:30 pm, we dive into an assortment of games, filled with laughter, camaraderie, and the chance to win some bragging rights!

The fun doesn't stop there. At 2:30 pm, we invite you to sway to the rhythm of Hawaiian music, immerse yourself in the festivities, and maybe even show off your hula skills! Whether you’re an avid dancer or prefer to enjoy the music from your seat, it promises to be an afternoon of delightful entertainment.

What makes this event even more special is that all the proceeds will be directed towards the Alzheimer's Foundation. By joining us at this event, not only are you in for a fantastic day, but you're also contributing to a very important cause.

Make sure you RSVP to Candra to secure your spot. We’re excited to share this day filled with food, fun, and community spirit with you.

Looking forward to seeing you all in your best Hawaiian outfits!

Aloha until then,

Leigh Boney

‍
Post Summary: You are invited to our Hawaiian Luau on June 9th, a tropical-themed event supporting the Alzheimer's Foundation with food, games, and dancing in the heart of our community.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Hope, Crafts, and Community: Gardens on Quail Joins the Fight to End Alzheimer’s
Post Body:
Gardens on Quail invites you to be part of something powerful—a day where creativity meets compassion.

On Friday, June 21st from 10 AM to 3 PM, we are hosting our annual Craft Fair Fundraiser in support of the Alzheimer’s Association Walk to End Alzheimer’s.

As proud members of The Forget Me Knot Family, our team includes passionate staff and supporters from all four Stage Management communities: Gardens on Quail, Golden Pond, Gardens at Columbine, and Stonebridge. Together, we walk not only to raise funds, but to honor the residents and families we serve every single day.

In 2024, our united team raised over $23,500, earning second place in the Denver Walk. This year, we’re aiming even higher with a goal of $30,000—and you can help us reach it.

Join us at the Gardens on Quail Craft Fair to:

  • Discover one-of-a-kind handcrafted items from local artisans
  • Win fun door prizes
  • Support Alzheimer’s research, care, and advocacy with every purchase

Whether you become a vendor, make a donation, or simply attend to shop and show your support, you’re helping to make a real difference in the lives of those facing Alzheimer’s.

📧 Interested in being a vendor? Email Holly Eames at heames@goldenpond.com
📱 Ready to walk with us or donate? Visit our team page: https://act.alz.org/site/TR/Walk2025/CO-Colorado?team_id=951161&pg=team&fr_id=18473 .

Let’s make every step—and every stitch—count. 💜

‍
Post Summary: Join us on a day where creativity meets compassion.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Navigating the Emotional Journey: Finding Comfort and Support in Choosing an Elder Care Facility
Post Body:
Making the decision to transition to an elder care facility is not just a practical process; it's an emotional journey filled with a myriad of feelings. It's normal to experience a range of emotions, from excitement and relief to anxiety and sadness.

At The Gardens on Quail, we understand the significance of this decision, and we're here to support you every step of the way. Below, we'll explore the emotional aspects of choosing a senior care facility for yourself or a loved one and provide guidance on finding comfort and support during this transformative time.

Embracing Change: Choosing an elder care facility marks a significant transition, both for the individual moving and their loved ones. It's natural to feel a mix of emotions, including:

  • Anticipation: Excitement and hope for new opportunities and experiences.
  • Anxiety: Worries about the unknown, leaving familiar surroundings, and adjusting to a new routine.
  • Sadness and Loss: Grieving the loss of independence, a former home, or the role of primary caregiver for a loved one.
  • Guilt: Feeling guilty about not being able to provide the level of care needed or about needing support oneself.
  • Relief: Recognizing the relief that comes from accessing professional care, ensuring safety and specialized assistance.
  • Optimism: Embracing the potential for new friendships, engaging activities, and a supportive community.

Finding Comfort and Support:

  • Acknowledge and Express Your Feelings: Allow yourself to process and express your emotions openly. Share your thoughts with trusted family members, friends, or support groups who can provide understanding and empathy.
  • Seek Guidance from Professionals: Our experienced staff and elder care experts are here to offer guidance, answer questions, and provide emotional support throughout the decision-making process.
  • Take Time for Self-Care: Engage in activities that bring you joy and relaxation. Prioritize self-care to replenish your emotional well-being and reduce stress.
  • Stay Connected: Maintain social connections with friends and family members. Regular communication and visits can help foster a sense of support and connection.
  • Focus on the Positives: Shift your mindset towards the positive aspects of the new living arrangement, such as the specialized care, new opportunities for socialization, and engaging activities available in an elder care facility.
  • Engage in the Transition Process: Involve yourself in the transition process, such as personalizing the new living space, participating in orientation programs, and getting to know the staff and fellow residents.

Real-life stories of individuals who have successfully navigated the emotional journey of choosing an elder care facility can provide inspiration and reassurance. We encourage you to read personal testimonials on our blog or speak with current residents and their families to gain insight into their experiences.

Remember, you are not alone—reach out to our caring staff, connect with others who have gone through similar experiences, and embrace the positive aspects of this new chapter. Together, we will navigate the emotional journey and ensure that you or your loved one finds comfort, support, and a fulfilling life in our community.

‍
Post Summary: We explore the emotional aspects of choosing a senior care facility for yourself or a loved one and provide guidance on finding comfort and support during this transformative time.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Say “Aloha!” to Summer: Join Us for a Luau Celebration
Post Body:
Sometimes summer asks us to slow down, kick off our shoes, and let a warm breeze do the talking. That’s exactly what we’re planning for Wednesday, July 30 at 11:00 AM when our courtyard turns into a mini-Hawaii—grass skirts swishing, smoky barbecue on the grill, ukulele chords floating over the flowers.

Why we’re excited
We’ve discovered that the best moments in our community aren’t scripted; they happen between residents swapping stories or a grandkid learning a hula move from their grandparent. A luau gives everyone—long-time residents, new families, curious neighbors—a reason to pull up a chair (or jump on the dance floor) and simply enjoy one another.

What the morning looks like

  • Live hula dancers & music – Most of us don’t know the steps, and that’s the fun of it.
  • Backyard-style Hawaiian BBQ – Think kalua pork, pineapple, and sides that taste like sunshine.
  • Easy games on the lawn – Nothing competitive; just laughter and maybe a little friendly teasing.
  • Open doors – Wander through the greenhouse, peek at the model apartments, or sit by the train set in the heated courtyard. Stay as long as you like.

Bring a spouse, an adult child, or a friend who’s wondering what senior living can feel like when it’s done with heart. There’s no program to sit through and no sales pitch—just people, music, and food.

Let us know you’re coming
A quick heads-up helps us make sure there’s enough brisket (and shade) for everyone.

Phone: 303-456-1500
Email: justin@gardensonquail.com

If you can’t make it but want to drop by another day, reach out anytime. Otherwise, we’ll have a lei waiting for you on July 30th. Until then—aloha, friends.

‍
Post Summary: Join us July 30 at 11:00 AM when our courtyard turns into a mini-Hawaii
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Senior Living Glossary: Understanding Key Terms and Concepts
Post Body:
Navigating the world of senior living can be overwhelming, especially with the abundance of terminology and acronyms used in the industry.

To help you better understand these terms and concepts, we've compiled a comprehensive glossary of senior living terms. Whether you're exploring independent living, assisted living, memory care, or other options, this glossary will provide clarity and insight into the terminology commonly used in the senior living landscape.

ADLs (Activities of Daily Living):
ADLs refer to the essential everyday activities that individuals perform to take care of themselves, including bathing, dressing, grooming, eating, transferring, and toileting.

AL (Assisted Living):
Assisted living is a type of senior housing that provides assistance with activities of daily living while promoting independence and offering a supportive environment for residents.

CCRC (Continuing Care Retirement Community):
CCRCs are senior living communities that offer a range of care options, including independent living, assisted living, and skilled nursing, allowing residents to age in place as their needs change.

IL (Independent Living):
Independent living communities are designed for active, self-sufficient older adults who desire a maintenance-free lifestyle, social engagement, and access to various amenities and services.

LTCI (Long-Term Care Insurance):
LTCI is an insurance policy that helps cover the costs associated with long-term care, including services provided in senior living communities, nursing homes, and home care.

MC (Memory Care):
Memory care is a specialized form of senior living designed for individuals with Alzheimer's disease, dementia, or other memory-related conditions. It offers tailored support, programs, and a secure environment to promote the well-being of residents.

SNF (Skilled Nursing Facility):
A skilled nursing facility, also known as a nursing home, provides 24-hour nursing care for individuals who require significant medical attention and assistance with daily activities.

Respite Care:
Respite care offers short-term relief to primary caregivers by providing temporary care for seniors in a senior living community or nursing home. It allows caregivers to take a break while ensuring their loved ones receive proper care.

Palliative Care:
Palliative care focuses on relieving symptoms and improving the quality of life for individuals with serious illnesses. It aims to address physical, emotional, and spiritual needs while providing comfort and support.

Age in Place:
Age in place refers to the ability of individuals to remain in their chosen residence or community as they age, with access to necessary services and support. It allows seniors to maintain independence and receive appropriate care as needed.

Hospice Care:
Hospice care offers compassionate end-of-life support and comfort to individuals with terminal illnesses. It focuses on pain management, emotional support, and enhancing the quality of life for both the individual and their family.

This glossary provides a starting point for understanding the terminology commonly used in the senior living industry. As you explore different care options and navigate your senior living journey, referring to this glossary will help you make informed decisions and have meaningful conversations with care providers and professionals. Remember, it's important to seek personalized advice from experts to ensure the best possible care for you or your loved one.
Post Summary: Navigating the world of senior living can be overwhelming, especially with the abundance of terminology and acronyms used in the industry.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Summer Fun Awaits: Gardens on Quail Craft Fair and Raffle
Post Body:
Get ready for a day of creativity, fun, and community spirit at our Summer Craft Fair! Join us this Saturday, August 17th, 2024, from 10 AM to 4 PM for an event you won't want to miss!

A Celebration of Crafts and Creativity

The Gardens on Quail will be transformed into a bustling marketplace featuring local artisans showcasing their unique, handcrafted treasures. Whether you're shopping for one-of-a-kind jewelry, home décor, or charming gifts, there's something for everyone to enjoy. Our Summer Craft Fair is the perfect opportunity to find that special item and support local talent.

Family Fun and Prizes

In addition to the incredible crafts, we're making it a day full of family-friendly fun! Be sure to participate in our door prize raffle. Tickets are available at $1 for 1 ticket or $5 for 6 tickets, with all proceeds going to the Walk to End Alzheimer’s. What better way to give back while also having the chance to win some exciting prizes?

Supporting a Great Cause 💜

Beyond the crafts and entertainment, this event carries a deeper purpose. All the proceeds from the raffle will contribute to the Walk to End Alzheimer’s, a cause close to our hearts. By attending, you’re not only supporting local artisans but also helping to raise awareness and funds for Alzheimer’s research and support.

If you can't make the event but still want to support us reaching our fundraiser goal, please donate here: https://act.alz.org/site/TR?pg=team&fr_id=17491&team_id=877349&s_src=nuclavismobile&s_subsrc=Nucl_Web_TmsQRC

We Can’t Wait to See You!

Mark your calendar, gather your family, and invite your friends to join us for a wonderful day of shopping, fun, and community. The Gardens on Quail is excited to welcome you, and we can't wait to celebrate the summer with you—all while making a meaningful difference together.
Post Summary: Join us this Saturday, August 17th at the Gardens on Quail Summer Craft Fair in Arvada, CO! Shop unique crafts, win prizes, and support Alzheimer’s awareness.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Swinging to the Classics: A Courtyard Concert
Post Body:
On a warm July evening, the air at Gardens on Quail was filled with the timeless tunes of the Big Band era, as the Sentimental Sounds Swing Band took center stage in our courtyard. Our residents were treated to a spectacular concert featuring classics from legends like Glenn Miller, Duke Ellington, and Benny Goodman.

More Than Just Music

The Sentimental Sounds Swing Band, a talented group of volunteer musicians, brought more than just music to our community. They brought a spirit of joy and a reminder of the timeless appeal of swing music, which resonates with both young and old. Their passion for performing was evident as they delivered each song with energy and precision, creating an atmosphere of fun and festivity.

A Community United by Music

As the evening unfolded, the concert became more than an entertainment event; it was a gathering that brought our community together. Residents sang along to the tunes they remembered, sharing stories of their youth and the dances they once enjoyed. It was a beautiful sight to see generations come together, united by the universal language of music.

Gratitude and Looking Forward

We are incredibly grateful to the Sentimental Sounds Swing Band for their performance. Their dedication to sharing the joy of music and supporting their community through volunteer efforts made the evening truly special.

Stay tuned to our event calendar for more live events like this, as we continue to bring engaging and entertaining performances to our residents. And don't forget to check out the band’s Facebook page to see where they will be playing next!

‍
Post Summary: Discover how our residents relived the magic of the Big Band era with a night of dancing, nostalgia, and timeless music.
Author: mariah-ruell

Name: Tie-Dye for a Cure: Craft, Shop & Make Memories at Gardens on Quail—June 21 💜
Post Body:
Nothing brings people together quite like a swirl of bright color and a shared purpose.

Earlier this month, our courtyard became a rainbow workshop as residents twisted, dipped, and revealed one-of-a-kind tie-dye shirts. Purple fingers flashed proud thumbs-ups, and each finished tee felt like a small flag of joy.

Those wearable works of art make their public debut at our Craft Fair Fundraiser this Friday, June 21, 10 AM–3 PM at Gardens on Quail in Arvada.

Stroll through the fair to browse local jewelry, woodwork, soaps, art prints, baked goods—and the residents’ vibrant tie-dye creations.

All proceeds support our Forget Me Knot Family Walk to End Alzheimer’s team, aiming to raise $30k for research and caregiver programs.

If you can’t make it in person, you’re welcome to cheer us on or donate online https://act.alz.org/site/TR/Walk2025/CO-Colorado?team_id=951161&pg=team&fr_id=18473.

We hope you’ll drop by, enjoy the color, and add your footsteps—or brushstrokes—to the effort. 💜

‍
Post Summary: Pick up a one-of-a-kind tie-dye tee—hand-made by Gardens on Quail residents—at our June 21 craft fair, and let every swirl of color support the Walk to End Alzheimer’s.
Author: mariah-ruell
